The death of Muhammad 'Abduh

A closely-watched funeral

Muhammad â€˜Abduh died on July 11, 1905. Because he was the leading Muslim thinker of Egypt and a prominent player in political and public life, it is not surprising that â€˜Abduhâ€™s illness, funeral, and memory were the subject of daily reports in the Egyptian Gazette.

The pro-British paper lauded the memory of the pro-British cleric.
